intro: Purdieanthus, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plants typically grow in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. They have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Purdieanthus species are often found in alpine or subalpine habitats, where they play a role in local ecosystems.
